intro: Stelis chlorantha, commonly known as the green-stem orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing on trees or rocks in shaded environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The orchid's flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
